title: compiler panic on OS X: 'can't create relative paths across filesystems' (regression)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
The `-C rpath` option, which has always been [nonfunctional](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/17219) on OS X, now causes a compiler panic.  (I only came across this by accident, because I never removed the option from my makefile after attempting to use it at the time I filed that issue.)
In this case, `relativize` in src/librustc_back/rpath.rs is being called with the arguments "/opt/lru/lib/rustlib/x86_64-apple-darwin/lib" and "/private/tmp".  There is actually only one filesystem involved, although I'm not sure why mounts would prevent relative paths from being created.

```

/tmp % RUST_BACKTRACE=1 rustc -C rpath hello.rs
```
